channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: The McKinney Student Writing Contest Is Now Open!
item.description: The 2025 McKinney Writing Contest is open, and both undergraduate and graduate students are invited to submit entries in a wide range of categories to win cash prizes! Entries are due by midnight on March 11, 2025. Please see the McKinney Writing Contest page for more information, or email the contest committee if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Therapy Dog Group Sessions to Continue November 6
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 5:00 PM - 6:30 PM - Register to join other students in the Mueller Center classroom to relax, de-stress, and pet some furry friends! If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center.
item.author: Students

item.title: H2M architects + RPI Student Meet & Greet to be held November 6
item.description: Join H2M at their Troy office right on River Street with food, non-alcoholic drinks and refreshment and music. This is a casual opportunity for RPI students to come meet professionals across architecture, engineering, construction and environmental sciences from a local employer. H2M is open to full-time seekers and interns in multiple areas.
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Schedules November 8 Information Session
item.description: Date: Friday, November 8, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates, and describes how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: EMPAC to Present American Premiere of Marina Rosenfeld’s μ (mu)
item.description: Date: Friday, November 8, 2024 7:00 PM - All are invited to a performance and video installation by Marina Rosenfeld as she makes the American premiere of her EMPAC-commissioned work “μ (mu)”. Titled after the mathematical term for friction or touch and inspired by the artist’s longstanding interest in turntablism, the work takes place along the surface of a dubplate at the moment of inscription.
item.author: Community

item.title: Don’t Miss “I Dream” in Concert on November 1!
item.description: Friday, November 1, 2024 at 7:00 pm - In partnership with RPI, the Musical Dramatic Arts Foundation is proud to present a concert version of the musical “I Dream,” which tells the story of the final 36 hours of Martin Luther King Jr.’s life as seen through the eyes of his closest friend, Ralph Abernathy. Learn more and Buy tickets
item.author: Community

item.title: Mercer X Affiliated Club Interest Meeting, Friday, November 1st, 8-9 pm, Mercer XLab Clubhouse
item.description:
Are you a part of a student club that could use an electronic makerspace as a second home? Does your club want to learn and share best practices with others? Do you need a space for workshops? Does your club want to improve its recruitment and retention? Join us Friday, November 1st, 8 pm in the Mercer XLab and Mercer X Lab Clubhouse on the 6th floor of the JEC to learn about what the Clubhouse offers and what we will ask of you! The Mercer X Clubhouse was created by students like you, for you.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Community
